means: 选中的，当选而尚未就职的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"选择"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: choose, select, elect, pick, prefer, opt
means: choose ： 普通用词，侧重根据个人意愿和判断从众多的对象中进行选择，着重被选者的优点。
select ： 书面用词，具有庄严、正式的感情色彩。强调精选。
elect ： 指按照一定的规章或法律，用投票等方式进行的认真慎重的选择。
pick ： 口语用词，多指从个人角度仔细挑选，也含任意挑选之意。
prefer ： 强调个人偏爱，不一定有选择的行动。
opt ： 多指在几种可能性之间进行选择。

sentence.Network_en: Councils should be answerable to the people who elect them.
sentence.Network_cn: 市政会成员应对推选他们的人负责。

sentence.Network_en: Concentrators in geological sciences elect either geology or geography.
sentence.Network_cn: 主修地质学的学生要选修地质学或地理课程.

sentence.Network_en: Austrian voters went to the polls this weekend to elect a successor to the President.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥地利选民这周末去投票中心选举下届总统。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin elect- 'picked out', from the verb eligere, from e- (variant of ex-) 'out' + legere 'to pick'

entry.def: When people elect someone, they choose that person to represent them, by voting for them.

example.ex: The people of the Philippines have voted to elect a new president...
example.tran: 菲律宾人民已投票选举出了一位新总统。

example.ex: Manchester College elected him Principal in 1956...
example.tran: 曼彻斯特学院于1956年推选他做院长。

entry.def: If you elect to do something, you choose to do it.

example.ex: Those electing to smoke will be seated at the rear.
example.tran: 那些想吸烟的人将坐在后排。

entry.tran: 已当选但未就任的;候任的
entry.def: Elect is added after words such as 'president' or 'governor' to indicate that a person has been elected to the post but has not officially started to carry out the duties involved.

example.ex: ...the date when the president-elect takes office.

sentences.sentence: "one of the elect who have power inside the government"

means.word_mean: 1. select by a vote for an office or membership;

sentences.sentence: "We elected him chairman of the board"
"I elected to have my funds deposited automatically"

means.word_mean: 2. elected but not yet installed in office;

lect讲,读,说+ure表名词→n.&v.演讲,讲课
col共同+lect选择→放在一起选择→收集

Sentence.sentence: He has been successfully elected Prime Minister.
Just one week after Obama was elected president, participants were less ready to support policies designed to address racial inequality than they had been two weeks before the election.

sentences.en: Then the congress elected its presidium.
sentences.cn: 然后代表大会选出主席团。

sentences.en: He elected that he should become a doctor.

jushi.english: The chairman was elected by secret ballot.
jushi.chinese: 主席由无记名投票选举。

jushi.english: Americans elect a President every four years.
jushi.chinese: 美国人民每隔四年选一次总统。

jushi.english: We elected two deputies among us.
jushi.chinese: 在我们当中选两名代表。
